body:
[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #239](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/239/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

[REEF-pull-request-windows3 #150](https://builds.apache.org/job/REEF-pull-request-windows3/150/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
@markusweimer, it should work with the latest push.
OK. testing.

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #240](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/240/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

[REEF-pull-request-windows3 #151](https://builds.apache.org/job/REEF-pull-request-windows3/151/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

The first build of this in VS or from the command line succeeds, and produces a DLL of ~42MB. I'll report on test results using that build separately.

However, subsequent builds fail, both from the command line and in Visual Studio. The reason is that the first build adds a file, `lang/cs/Org.Apache.REEF.Client/Properties/Resources.resx`. This file doesn't have the proper license header, hence RAT fails. Also, this file is shown in `git status` after the build, and we run the risk of adding it to the repository which would be good to avoid for build output.

Is it possible to move generated files into output folders of the project in .NET? On the Java side, we put them into `target/` and its subfolders. That folder is ignored by both Git and RAT. Also, it makes `clean` a much more deterministic build target.

Test results are in. The _good news_: The tests that failed before now pass.

The _bad news_: Bizarrely, I now see different tests fail:

```
Test Name:  TestHttpRequestSerializationBytesRoundTrip
Test FullName:  Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests.TestHttpSerialization.TestHttpRequestSerializationBytesRoundTrip
Test Source:    c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests\TestHttpSerialization.cs : line 59
Test Outcome:   Failed
Test Duration:  0:00:00

Result Message: Unable to create instance of class Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests.TestHttpSerialization. Error: System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests.TestHttpSerialization' threw an exception. ---> System.IO.FileLoadException: Could not load file or assembly 'Org.Apache.REEF.Utilities, Version=0.12.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies. The located assembly's manifest definition does not match the assembly reference. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131040).
Result StackTrace:  
at Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests.TestHttpSerialization..cctor()
 --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
    at Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests.TestHttpSerialization..ctor()
```

And:

```
Test Name:  TestHttpRequestSerializationJasonRoundTrip
Test FullName:  Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests.TestHttpSerialization.TestHttpRequestSerializationJasonRoundTrip
Test Source:    c:\src\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests\TestHttpSerialization.cs : line 41
Test Outcome:   Failed
Test Duration:  0:00:00

Result Message: Unable to create instance of class Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests.TestHttpSerialization. Error: System.TypeInitializationException: The type initializer for 'Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests.TestHttpSerialization' threw an exception. ---> System.IO.FileLoadException: Could not load file or assembly 'Org.Apache.REEF.Utilities, Version=0.12.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null' or one of its dependencies. The located assembly's manifest definition does not match the assembly reference. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80131040).
Result StackTrace:  
at Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests.TestHttpSerialization..cctor()
 --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
    at Org.Apache.REEF.Common.Tests.TestHttpSerialization..ctor()
```

@markusweimer moved resx to a bin directory. Please check
@markusweimer I have not made changes around TestHttpSerialization. Not sure if this is related to this PR.
Those tests pass in current `master`, though. Hence, a change here might be triggering their failure. I'll re-run tests with the latest push and report.
OK, I can now build twice in a row and the DLL is 42MB in size.

Good news. All tests now pass. Shall we attribute the failure earlier to MSBuild randomization and call it a day? If so, can you please address the last open comment such that I can merge it in time before the 0.13 cutoff?

@bgchun and I discussed. My thinking has changed -- we shouldn't be overly aggressive removing deprecated methods for 0.12. I'll close this PR and instead open some more incremental changes.

Looks like there's a problem with this pull request
Rebased onto current `master`

I did clean build. The file size is correct. But I don't see the jar file in client.dll. Is the jar party of the client.dll?

REEF.Tests project still copies the jar file. Shall we remove it?
@dkm2110 I've done a pass.

Is it possible to change this _not_ to use abstract base classes we expect runtimes to implement? This introduces the [fragile base class problem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fragile_base_class). Instead, move the methods we expect the runtime to implement into an interface, and expect and instance of that interface to be injected via Tang.

[REEF-pull-request-windows3 #160](https://builds.apache.org/job/REEF-pull-request-windows3/160/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
@markusweimer OK, will update soon. Thanks for the feedback!
Yes, the idea is very much that the JAR is part of the DLL. And yes, we should probably remove the logic that copies it around by itself.
Tests passed in my machine as well.

> Tests passed in my machine as well. 

Great! @beysims Can you address the last open comment about documentation and visibility of `ResourceHelper`?

After that, I can merge it. We should, however, also file an issue with the changes needed to the tests and other code which might still needlessly copy the JAR. @jwang98052 you know that code best, can you enumerate the places in a JIRA?

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #253](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/253/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

[REEF-pull-request-windows3 #161](https://builds.apache.org/job/REEF-pull-request-windows3/161/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

In order to minimize the impact this change has on current and future users, we should keep the NuGet for `Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.JAR`, but remove it from the `Org.Apache.REEF.All` NuGet. That way, new users will be able to benefit from this change, while old users need to only change one line in their build files, to add the `Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.JAR` NuGet.
Removed jar nuget dependency for all nuget.
